Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First lets examine the data Event summary Observations The sequence seems to show a cycle Events 1-3 low temperature 20-21 pressure 1 vibration 0 material flow 0 tool position 0 energy relatively low 0.4-0.5 This appears to be idle or standby state Then events 4-6 temperature rises to 50-58 pressure 1-1.5 vibration 30-38 material flow 5 tool position increases from 5 to 10 energy 2-3

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: events 7-8 temperature drops to 40 pressure 2 vibration 10 material flow 2 tool position 15 energy 2 event 9 temperature spikes to 80 pressure 2 vibration 50 material flow 0 tool position 15 energy 5 event 10 temperature drops to 30 pressure 1 vibration 1 material flow 0 tool position 15 energy 1 Events 11-12 temperature 25 pressure 1 vibration 5 material flow 1 tool position 20 energy 1.5-1.6 Events 13-15 back to initial low values temperature 20-21 pressure 1 vibration 0 material flow 0 tool position 0 energy around 0.5

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: overall the machine seems to go through a cycle idle then a heating active phase 4-6 then a moderate phase 7-8 then a high-temperature spike 9 then cooldown 10 then a light activity 11-12 then idle

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: assign meaningful labels Events 1-3 Idle Events 4-6 Cutting Metal high temp vibration material flow tool moving Events 7-8 Assembling Parts pressure higher moderate temp lower vibration some flow Event 9 Welding high temperature high vibration no flow Event 10 Cooling low activity Events 11-12 Quality Inspection slight vibration material flow tool movement Events 13-15 Idle

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: map sensor readings to likely operations Temperature rise due to friction cutting or heating welding Pressure indicate clamping force Vibration indicates movement cutting grinding Material Flow coolant or raw material feed Tool Position location of tool Energy power consumption

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - IND
Text: Alternatively it could be a CNC machine stages tool approach cutting retract Or plastic injection molding temperature rises pressure for injection vibration screw rotation material flow plastic melt tool position screw position Or metal forging heating pressing Given problem expects manufacturing activities like Cutting Assembling Welding Inspection Packaging

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: use typical manufacturing processes part cut from raw material then assembled then welded then inspected then packaged map clusters to Cutting 4-6 Assembling 7-8 Welding 9 Quality Inspection 11-12 Idle 1-3 and 13-15

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event clusters Cluster A events 1-3 low values Cluster B events 4-6 temp rising pressure 1-1.5 vib high flow 5 tool moving Cluster C events 7-8 temp 40 pressure 2 vib 10 flow 2 tool 15 Cluster D event 9 temp 80 vib 50 flow 0 Cluster E event 10 low Cluster F events 11-12 moderate low tool 20 Cluster G events 13-15 baseline

Name: Validation - PE
Text: confirm patterns Cutting involves high vibration temperature increase coolant flow matches 4-6 Assembling pressure elevated steady tool matches 7-8 Welding high heat no flow high energy matches 9 Cooling temp drop matches 10 Inspection low vib flow tool move matches 11-12 reject alternatives like 4-6 as heating because high vibration

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: maybe events 7-8 part of 9 but sensor change significant maybe combine 10 with Welding as post-weld or 10-12 as Inspection but distinct readings maybe events 13-15 Packaging but low activity more Idle

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: detailed rationale Idle low readings baseline Cutting Metal Events 4-6 temp jumps 21 to 58 vibration 0 to 38 flow 0 to 5 tool increases energy rises Assembling Parts Events 7-8 pressure 2 steady position moderate temp flow lubrication Welding Event 9 temp 80 vib 50 flow 0 energy 5 Cooling Event 10 temp drops to 30 low readings Quality Inspection Events 11-12 vib 5 flow 1 tool to 20 moderate energy
